title: Tyson Fury knocks out Cesaro after brawl with Braun Strowman on WWE Raw
text:
Tyson Fury punched Cesaro twice after WWE Raw went off air (WWE)

Tyson Fury knocked out Cesaro following his brawl with Braun Strowman on WWE Raw on Monday night.

Fury made a surprise appearance on WWE Smackdown last Friday and attempted to get in the ring to confront Strowman before he was held back by security.

But the former world heavyweight champion showed up again on Monday as he faced Strowman and demanded an ‘apology’ from the WWE superstar.

However, the pair ended up sparking a mass brawl and needed to be separated by several other wrestlers.

Raw’s televised broadcast ended with Fury and Strowman separated in opposite corners of the ring.

But the WWE has revealed that after the show went off air, Fury knocked out Cesaro with two punches after the Swiss wrestler attempted to calm the former boxing heavyweight champion.

Tyson Fury with the knockout blow to Cesaro after #RAW goes off air! pic.twitter.com/dkrQGFQ8B6 — Adam Waybright (@WaybrightAdam) October 8, 2019

Fury is currently on a break from boxing following his win over Otto Wallin in Las Vegas last month.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The Gypsy King suffered two nasty cuts above his eye, one of which required 47 stitches to heal.

Fury is scheduled to fight Deontay Wilder in their rematch in February 2020.
